alert.note: Alert for Central Chelan County; Wenatchee Area; Western Chelan County; Western Okanogan County (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 3:02PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Chelan and southwestern Okanogan Counties through 330 PM PDT... At 300 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 19 miles southeast of Holden Village, or 31 miles northeast of Stevens Pass, moving north at 10 mph. This storm is just west of the 25 Mile burn scar. Those near or downstream of the burn scar need to pay close attention to this storm. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... 25 Mile Creek State Park, Ramona Park Campground, Fox Creek Campground, South Navarre Campground, Prince Creek Campground, Cottonwood Campground, Silver Falls Campground, and Grouse Mountain Campground. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central Chelan County; Wenatchee Area; Western Chelan County; Western Okanogan County
